text: Hi Everyone, I'd like to ask for you help regarding verifying the domain of account in HubSpot. Usually how long does it take to propagate? I added the dns settings of HubSpot to our server but still it is showing that it is not verified.

Hi All :wave:, Does anyone know, if it's possible to create a blog in a sandbox account? It seems to want a domain first, which requires a paid account. The main non-sandbox account is paid. But I'm building the theme in the sandbox.

To the powers that be: <@U7SL518D6> <@UD53A9UUR> <@U6W3H6YN8> The `{% raw %}` tag breaks a bit when you use it inside of a macro. Im using it in conjunction with handlebars temlates and it seems to treat handlebar’s `{{#each}}`  statments as the start of a comment that never gets closed. So it comments out all of my code after the macro.

In this case the macro isn’t needed but makes the code cleaner. But just thought that I would bring it to your attention.

This is interesting. BJ do you mind sending me a DM link to a file where you are trying to do this in. I will raise this internally. I have no idea of the level of work that may be involved to solve for this use-case, so fair warning it may not be a quick fix.
I ran into this when using angular way back on a client site. Would something like this be able to help you: <https://github.com/jonschlinkert/handlebars-delimiters>

It might! But honestly it’s not worth trying hahaha Its a pretty small section in a large file and it would be nice to include it in a macro - but im in a bit of a time pinch and just have to fire from the hip at this point :slightly_smiling_face:

It’s also worth noting that — at the very least it might be beneficial to include some kind of warning in design tools that fires off when a raw tag is put inside of a macro saying something along the lines of “This might break something on your page — but it might not — raw tags should be used outside of macros for full support”

I spent a solid 2 hours trying to figure out what was wrong with my code when it turned out to be a hs thaannggg. Had it thrown some kind of warning that would have helped a lot :slightly_smiling_face:
I found a bug in v3 crm properties api
The resource works at v2 api and not works at v3 api
Or, do you want help me?
Sorry that was ment to be a joke,
